tool.name: UCSC pslCDnaFilter
tool.description: Filter cDNA alignments in psl format
tool.command: pslReps -minAli=0.25 '${alignment}' output.reps.psl output.reps.psr && faPolyASizes '${query}' query.polyA && pslCDnaFilter #if $assembly_type == "native" -localNearBest=0.001 #if $assembly_category == "finished" -minId=0.95 -minCover=0.25 #else if $assembly_category == "well-ordered" -minId=0.95 -minCover=0.15 #else -minId=0.94 -minAlnSize=80 #end if #else -localNearBest=0.010 #if $assembly_category == "finished" -minId=0.35 -minCover=0.25 #else if $assembly_category == "well-ordered" -minId=0.35 -minCover=0.15 #else -minId=0.33 -minAlnSize=80 #end if #end if -minQSize=20 -ignoreIntrons -repsAsMatch -ignoreNs -bestOverlap -polyASizes=query.polyA output.reps.psl '${output_filtered}'

param.name: assembly_type
param.label: Choose your type of cDNA sequence

param.name: assembly_category
param.label: Choose your genome assembly category
param.option: well-ordered assemblies (well ordered, whole genome shotgun)
low-coverage assemblies (low coverage (< 4x"), lots of contigs, N50 scaffold size < 1mb)

tool.help:
pslCDnaFilter (version: v340) ============================== Filter cDNA alignments in psl format. Filtering criteria are comparative, selecting near best in genome alignments for each given cDNA and non-comparative, based only on the quality of an individual alignment.
usage: -------
$ pslCDnaFilter [options] inPsl outPsl
Source code: -------------
http://hgdownload.cse.ucsc.edu/admin/exe/
